revised_title: Fossil Plant Organization in Coal Measures: Myelopteris, Psaronius, and Kaloxylon
tldr: The author examines the organization of fossil plants from the coal measures, specifically focusing on Myelopteris, Psaronius, and Kaloxylon. They analyze the structure and characteristics of these plants, discussing their classification and relationship to other plant groups. The author concludes that these plants belong to the aberrant group of Marattiaceae and provides detailed descriptions of their sections and vascular bundles.
